My friends and I absolutely love this game to death. There are plenty of pros and cons though

PROS:
-fun game
- you are able to play with multiple people on 1 computer
- 8 players
- fun and unpredictable gameplay
- an entertaining gamemode (NPC vs Players) for when you don't have Internet
- The costumes are amazing

CONS:
- considering that I managed to get Skyrim and all 3 DLCs for $16, it sucks that this game is $20
- You can ONLY play with people that are with you IRL (I know they're working on online mode though)
- Since its new, it has bugs (for example on the map with the giant fan, if every player is on 1 side of the map there is a chance that the camera will show plain black from outside of the map)

SUGGESTIONS
- Once you got your big stuff like online mode sorted out, lower the price to around $5-$10. It's a fun game but, if you wanna get multiplayer up and running, people aren't gonna wanna pay $80 so then 4 friends can play and having only one for $20 is kinda useless unless they're with you.
- add costumes to the game that cost around 10c each and can be bought on the Steam Market and also the Main Menu. Over time this will contribute to the money that you earn and won't be too much for people to pay whilst simultaneously not being as much work as some of the other options.
- Give us an ability to make profiles so then we don't have to wait for up to 8 players to choose their outfit and it will also give us the ability to have a name next to our score.
- If you are doing the 10c outfit idea, set up the workshop so people can make outfits that you could look over and put into the game
- you guys probably won't do it but, maybe you could do a main story kind of thing, release a mission a month or something like that so there's a little more to do when you're either alone or want to play something new.



Great game, great concept, great fun

- Keep it simple, Just have 6 buttons at the beginning

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer - I have been gifted a free key for this game for review purposes, however, my review will be kept as truthful as possible since I am meant to help developers and buyers/gamers.
Gang Beasts  review:

Overall description
Gang Beasts is an arcade beat-em-up game which is largely based around physics and not exactly meant to be taken seriously. You play as a jelly man/jelly baby, fighting other jellies in a bunch of different scenarios such as on trucks on a highway, or even on a giant bong. The default controls were quite ‘meh’, so I advise them to be changed. There’s a ton of different levels, such as Gondola most of which have their own unique ways of dying/other actions, such as Gondola allows you to knock your opponents off their elevator by you yourself using your head to bash their connector wires, and make them, yourself and their gondola fall to a miserable death. You can change largely how your character looks, be a bear, a blue bear, a red bear, other creatures. The main menu is empty, it only has ‘settings’ and ‘play’ options in the main menu. Not really that great. It could go whit a level editor, full on character customisation (maybe saving presets?).

Gameplay
Fun, addictive, intriguing, button mash to win. You can just simply bash your head against your opponent and win 8/10 times. Then kick their KO’d body into a river of their own blood. It’s hilarious what you can do, pick up a literal giant of a jelly (2.5x the size of your jelly) and just throw them out of the ring. Sadly enough, there’s no level editor as of now, so you can’t make a death circus, however, you can still laugh at the AI or your friends. Spawn mega-AI jellies, or bring your friends along to play a LAN match or few. Sadly it’s only LAN multiplayer, no servers, so again, a downside (but who needs friends anyway right?).

Pros and cons
Pros:
Fun combos to pull off
A ton of levels
Singleplayer and multiplayer
Support for multiple controllers
Amazing physics

Cons:
The singleplayer is boring
If you are playing by yourself, you will need to use a cheat to spawn in more enemies
Not many game-modes
I have been gifted the key by the kind developers of the game. They make my review about games like this possible.

Early Access Review

I frickin' love Gang Beasts. Has a lot of the type of fun not dissimilar to Super Smash Brothers or button mashy fighting games. After a thirty minute test run, it can be observed the game runs quite well even when eight players are on screen, and even at the lowest setting the game still looks very asthetically pleasing. Coming from someone who played the free pre-alpha for at least 30 hours with different groups of friends and had an absolute blast doing it, i can say i'm very excited for upcoming updates and encourage you to buy a few gamepads and round up some friends to try it; it's really the best party game i've ever played.

Pros:
- Pretty cheap, indie price. (20 dollars, 15 dollars)
- Lots of update potential from new developer. (It's also being produced by Double Fine.)
- Functional and smooth running.
- A good amount of levels ranging from wrestling rings and highways, to ferris wheels and meat grinders.
- People in fox suits beating the tar out of people in chicken suits on top of moving trucks.

Cons:
- When running a lot of physics calculations (especially at 8 players), the FPS can chug a bit.
- Climbing at it's current state is difficult to pull off.
- No way to rebind controls.
- The very fun sandbox level has been removed, but hopefully not for long.
- Above all, the game is in EARLY ACCESS, which means it is going to have features added constantly. While the game isn't bare bones, it lacks a single player mode and a few other features. Support the developers if you can. :)

In closing, Gang Beasts is a game i've had a lot of fun with, and patiently await more updates while i dangle my friends over pits of fire.

0.2.5b build

Gang Beasts is at its best as a novelty party game.  With the right group of friends this physics-based jelly people wrestling is a blast.  Check out some videos of it on youtube.  If you laugh your head off and are desperate to play it with friends then get it.  The fighting is brilliant, and experimenting with all the different combinations of wobbly break dance fighting will earn some big laughs, and plenty of happy shouting when you throw your mate into the grinder and watch him (or her) attempt a fruitless escape.

Its a bit content-light right now, but there is plenty of fun to be had, and there is loads of stuff on the way.

On to the negative.  Its not a game with a great deal of replay value unless you can organise three player matches.
Single player gets boring quickly after you've seen all there is to see.  You will get a lot of laughs, and certain levels will have earned a soft spot in your heart, but right now there isn't much to do past the first 45 minutes of play.

Presumably, this replay factor will improve once story mode and more game modes are implemented, but right now its not a game solo fighters will want to spend $20 on.

However if you have a couple of mates keen to play this with you then get on board.  At 40% off its a blast and well worth the money.  It even has the potential to replace Smash Bros as your go to fighting game with friends.

*I don't have many hours in this game on Steam yet, but I've played for around 100 hours through the alpha the developers posted on ModDB and such.*

TL;DR : Oh. Hell. Yes.
Welcome to Gang Beasts.

This game is truely remarkable. The art style, the gameplay, the simple yet satisfying fighting mechanics, the ever growing set of maps. And for $20? I got it on sale for $15 after I had played the alpha and beta extensively, and I get more enjoyment out of this game when playing with friends than several other $60 games I've played. I've played this game for hours on end with friends at LAN events and at houses. It really just works.

The maps are varied and interesting with plenty of map hazards (Grinders of Doom) , and the developers are adding new maps all the time. You can wrassle your comrades on top of fast moving vans on a highway, in an active subway system, in a warehouse filled with dangerous vents, in a factory with grinders everywhere in the floor, in an incinerating trash disposal plant, even on a moving ferris wheel (complete with catchy fairgrounds music).

Despite the fact that it's in Early Access, It's relatively bug free compared to many other titles in the same state of development. The combat is slick and simple. You'd be surprised the maneuvers  you can pull off with just two separate punch buttons, jump, grab and a victory pose button. No online multiplayer yet. (Soon?)

However the game, like many others, has its flaws. Before this gets too long, let's do some Pros and Cons :

Pros
Great concept and gameplay
Art style and performance/optimization are great
Fantastic party game and local multiplayer
Great maps, soundtrack
Good value for $20 price tag
Simple and intuitive controls
Cons
Minor Bugs
Relatively small game, needs some more content (I know it's Early Access, but some weapons or something wouldn't hurt)
No AI/Singleplayer
No online multiplayer
Despite these flaws (that can and probably will be fixed/changed by full release), the game is incredibly fun to play and should be an instabuy for anyone looking for a fun little game for one to eight players. I hope this review helped those who were looking for an honest review of the game!

Enjoy one of the most fun fighting games I've ever played!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Excellent game to play with your friends when you have time or just so happen to have them over... Only to introduce them to a game they'll want to play for revenge the next time they're over. So let me start off by saying for one this game is absolutely amazing and don't understand why people are giving this game so much hate when there isn't an online multiplayer.

Give me a moment to point something out
The game DOES have ONLINE MULTIPLAYER
It is, however; still in BETA
The way to obtain said multiplayer is not through steam itself, check out news for the game and you'll be given directions to get a key for the multiplayer.

With that out of the way the game is extremely fun when you finally get the beta for the online multiplayer. It's all in the patience since the keys for the beta are taking an extremely long time to get out to the public, but hey, it'll make the game that more enjoyable when they start giving them out a lot more often.

Adressing some of the controls I would have to recommend using an gamepad, like an xbox controller or whatever console you have that just so happens to have a usb that can be used. Incredibly difficult to use the keyboard.

Graphics are absolutely flawless with the hilarity that it comes with. Sure there are a few drawbacks with bugs within the meshes or whatever reason people have to hate on the game with because of the outrageous graphics standards some gamers have come to expect. I find the physics of this game to be hilarious and extremely enjoyable to the point that I don't even pay attention to the minor graphical details within the game or how the physics work because thats what adds to the fun of the game is to... watch it glitch or break for a few moments.

Paying attention with the recent updates with the game there are ways you can add replay-ability within the game itself even if you're going solo because for some reason you have nothing else to do. Pressing CTRL with #9 will spawn a big BEEFY (Beef city.. heh..) AI enemy for you to mercilessly bombard with headbutts and the flailing of whatever you to can throw at it only to immerge victorious and throw him into a grinder... Ahem.

This game is definitely recommended especially when you have friends over... brothers/sisters you wanna get revenge on for picking on you... or to jump on your friends when you all finally get that sweet, sweet online multiplayer key...

Right off the bat, I'll say that this game isn't worth it if you can't play with a friend. There is still about 4 hours fun in singleplayer, just spawning in enemy AI and attacking it, and the combat is extremely satisfying, but you'll end up getting bored quickly if you plan on playing by yourself.

That being said, with friends, this is THE party game. Not only is it fun, but thrilling, unpredictable fun. Unpredictable in the sense that this game will constantly take you by surprise, whether that surprise comes in the form of your unconscious friend regaining consciousness and suddenly uppercutting you into a pit of fire, or with you accidentally sparta-kicking your friend through a pane of glass on an elevator, there's a lot of sudden surprises.

In Gang Beasts, you're in complete control. Every move your character makes is a result of your actions, and combat isn't just built on static animations. You get real satisfaction knowing that you finally uppercutted someone off the side of a moving truck without the aid of a quicktime event or a static animation to do it for you.

Not only does this game have brilliant combat, but also brilliant parkour. Dare I say it, but Gang Beasts almost rivals Grow Home for parkour. Between climbing to safety on a dangling window cleaning platform while your persistent friend tries to break the only cable still holding said platform, to swinging through an elevator window and doing a falied backflip before concussing yourself on the floor, it is very responsive and leaves you drastically clutching your controller.

The downsides, of course, are the lack of online multiplayer and mod support. Not even full blown mod support, but just the ability to make your own levels. Online multiplayer speaks for itself. With that, you could discredit my entire spiel about the singleplayer part of this game.

So, if you enjoy fighting games and party games, GET THIS. Of course, there is a bit of a technical side involved with hooking up controllers and such, but once you sort it out, you've got a flawless party game that'll keep you satisfied for hours on end.

Early Access Review

I just played for hours at a friends house, and then immediately bought it and tried it at home. The game was hilarious while it lasted. It really did remind me of what it was like to be a kid and laugh my butt off while fighting friends in a video game. But eventually, the lack of content made the game quickly become boring.

As it stands, it's alpha-alpha-alpha. It's got all of ~5-6 maps, and each map lasts 30 seconds to a minute in a typical battle. Do the math there. They really could of, should of, added more than twice the content into this release before going to Greenlight. Compare it to half the other games on here and this game is almost empty.

I do recommend the game, in the hopes that they add a ton of content. But as it stands, $20 is very expensive for what right now amounts to a very simple Unity tech demo. A demo that could have been thrown together in a weekend by a more experienced group of developers.

Gang Beasts, a truly brilliant and hilarious game to play with your friends locally. better yet, there is news of and online-multiplayer coming soon!

The game is simple to learn and provides hours of fun with your friends as you cling for your dear life as your 'friend' decides either to let you fall to your doom or pick you back up. Since the latest major update the game has been much better. With better visuals, maps, animations and moves, Gang Beasts has become one of my favourite games to own with hours of replayability value to it. This game is a must buy!

However, until the multiplayer is released, I would not recommend buying due to it's relatively high price-point for what it is. Unless you are living with a large group of people like me, it is difficult to see how the average gamer would get their uses out of this locally multiplayer game! Nevertheless, the game is brilliant and a huge laugh to play with friends!

Updated review 25/05/2016

For now, at least, it's not recommended from me. Buy yourself that DLC you've always wanted or something to pass the time until the weird beta is available to all.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TL;DR: Good idea of a game, shame the actual content you get at purchase is poor. Beta access only available through request that can take an extremely long time.
You'll see people playing this game on Twitch or Youtube. Playing online with 8 people and it looks a hell of a lot of fun, it's had me laughing more than any game I've played*.

But when you go to buy the game, it fails to mention that what you'll be buying is some really old version that hasn't been updated in such a long time.
The survival mode on the version you'll get you might survive a few rounds but it gets boring really fast.

In order to play with people online like you'll see on Twitch/Youtube you need to apply to join the beta.
This wouldn't be a problem if the game you get for your £11.99 wasn't so boring on it's own.

For the price they're asking, I can't justify the purchase. I'm really hoping to get into the multiplayer beta before the 14 day refund option passes by that time my hype would have died off anyway.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my favourite party game of all time! If you are playing on a lan with your friends, this is the game to play. A massive improvement over the demo. First of all the movement is so much better, instead of waddling along moving quite slowly they now made the characters run. This makes the game a lot faster then it used to be. You can also climb which is very useful for getting over ledges that you are hanging from instead of falling to your death. They have made the celerbrate move and lift action on the same button which I find to be better. You can turn the health and stamina bar on or off if you feel like it.You can now also K.O. someone much faster than before as you could take so many punches before going down. You can now were costumes! There is about 8 costumes which gives some variety to the characters. There is 7 maps ans sadly they got rid of the sandbox and street maps, but they maps will forever be in our hearts :(. If enough people stand up we can make them bring back the those two maps. None of the maps have AI so you can only play with friends. You can choose how much lives you get, max is 100 lives. This game supports 8 players, but I tell you 8 players is FPS EATER!!!, unless you have a high-end PC you are fine :D. There is no control mapping which is pretty stupid as some people would like to change the controls. so you don't need to try and figure out what the controls are I will list them for you:
PC
Move- WASD
Left punch- left click
Right punch- right click
Jump/climb- Space
Duck- Ctrl
Lift/celerbrate- Left shift
Kick- E

Xbox controller
Move- Left analog stick
Left punch- LB
Right punch- RB
Jump/climb- A
Duck- B
Lift/celerbrate- Y
Kick- X

In other words this game is so awesome and you should definitly buy it. If enough people buy the game the dev's will make ONLINE MULTIPLAYER!!! That would just be awesome!

I have the bare-minimum specs, so I didn't expect this game to run with decent graphics settings.  However, it's sluggish to the point of barely being playable at all.

With the latest update, graphics options are set higher than what my system can handle and even though I change them in the Video menu, they reset after EVERY. SINGLE. BATTLE.  This means having to go into the options menu again and changing everything back, with 2 second delays in between each keystroke.

It boggles my mind how a relatively simple game with four characters throwing each other around in a small arena is more intensive on my system than games like Fallout 3, Oblivion, or Borderlands 2.

Unless they fix the graphical issues, I'd recommend saving your money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The thing is I really want to rate this game highly, but I just can't bring myself to do so in its current state. The idea of some crazed drunken blobs trying to kick each other out of a ring, is kinda fun. I love local multi-player games like this.

Alas so much seems broken, like some occasional crashes, the fact that pausing the game quits it, which can be turned off from the menu (something not right here), which occaisonally (the menu) doesn't work using a control pad. The wave mode sometimes refuses to spawn enemies and there are the odd pauses during gameplay that are unexplained, also the fact you can get lost behind scenary never to be seen. The controls are limited and it is mostly about spamming the buttons to knock someone out, and then lob them out of the arena. And let's be honest here, the controls are unweildy to say the least. Admittedly you do get better through-trial and error and by doing a bit of research, but dear lord is it unpredictable to say the least.

I realise it's early acess and I wish I could bring myself to dedicate more time to it, but whenever me and friends come back to give this game a go there are silly issues that stop us enjoying it, and it never seems to be evolving after all this time. This game has one trick up it's sleeve and that trick is getting old already.

To summarise: A fun idea that is great for a while but flawed in its execution. I hope it grows into something more substantial and gets the polish it deserves. I live in hope.
